metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33621 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The cgi gem before 0.1.0.2, 0.2.x before 0.2.2, and 0.3.x before 0.3.5 forRuby allows HTTP response splitting. This is relevant to applications thatuse untrusted user input either to generate an HTTP response or to create aCGI::Cookie object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8
ruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8').
jruby package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
